content.raw:
Thanks. I'll take a look at this next Monday.

There are some fairly roundabout ways of manipulating dataframes in lyse, because the functionality to do what we wanted more directly was not available when we started using pandas. Pandas seems to be changing rapidly, maybe there are more kosher ways of doing these things now. I assume the problem you're describing probably comes down to something in `dataframe_utilities.replace_with_padding()` since that's where the replacing of a row happens after an analysis routine runs.
